meanings.definition: To remain in a place or position
meanings.sent1: I will upstay here until you return.
meanings.sent2: The cat likes to upstay on the windowsill.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy dog decided to upstay on the cozy rug.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to upstay in her job was admirable.
meanings.sent5: The old tree seemed to upstay in the forest forever.

meanings.sent1: The strong pillars upstay the roof of the house.
meanings.sent2: A good friend will always upstay you during tough times.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape seemed to upstay him as he flew through the sky.
meanings.sent4: Kind words can upstay someone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The safety net upstays the trapeze artist during the performance.

meanings.sent1: The traffic jam upstayed our journey to the beach.
meanings.sent2: Please don't upstay the progress of the project.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to upstay the gardener by stealing his tools.
meanings.sent4: The storm upstayed the flight schedule at the airport.
meanings.sent5: His forgetfulness upstayed the completion of the task.

meanings.sent1: Despite the challenges, she managed to upstay and succeed.
meanings.sent2: The old building upstays through many years of wear and tear.
meanings.sent3: The little plant upstayed through the harsh winter and bloomed in spring.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship upstayed despite the distance between them.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's determination to upstay until the finish line paid off.
